data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3305431,"name":"Chris Voon","username":"woofer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/woofer/{size}/164066_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-09T05:03:28.123Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello! My team is having some issues with \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCTRE\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Cross The Road Electronics\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e’s swerve api. The target angle setpoints of the module rapidly flip by 180 degrees for some reason when we try to control them. Even using setControl with SwerveRequest.PointWheelsAt has this issue. Any idea how to solve this problem? Code is at this link: \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/Team5924/FRC-2024/tree/drive\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eGitHub - Team5924/FRC-2024 at drive\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThanks!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-02-09T05:03:28.123Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":89,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":515.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":454007,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-api-module-angle-setpoints-rapidly-flip-by-180-degrees","display_username":"Chris Voon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Team5924/FRC-2024/tree/drive","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - I’m guessing based on your constants that you are using the (non-flipped) Swerve X modules with the 5.14 driver gear ratio, is that correct? Using the Tuner X Swerve generator to only generate the constants for these modules, the only difference I see is that you set the \u003ccode\u003ekCoupleRatio\u003c/code\u003e to 3.5, but the defaults I got are 8/3. If you change this, does this fix your issue?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-02-09T07:53:29.458Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":454007,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-api-module-angle-setpoints-rapidly-flip-by-180-degrees","display_username":"jdao","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24178,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4201 Mentor, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-api-module-angle-setpoints-rapidly-flip-by-180-degrees/454007/2","custom_user_title":"4201 Mentor, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3305496,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-09T13:53:46.864Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhen you ran the Tuner X swerve steer verification test, did your steer motors all spin counter-clockwise as seen from the top of the robot? you use the ctre project generator directlu or did you try to customize/create your own.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe didn’t know about the generator and had similar problems. All of them stemmed from inconsistant use of inches and meters in the tunerconfig. The one that made our robot work similar to what you are describing is that we decided to make the x an y offset meters as that is what pathplanner and the drove class uses. But we didnt remove the conversion to meters when the drive class was created. This means your swerve modules are on top of each other and all sorts of bad things happen.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-02-10T13:20:13.922Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":14.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":454007,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-api-module-angle-setpoints-rapidly-flip-by-180-degrees","display_username":"Matt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51104,"username":"woofer","name":"Chris Voon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/woofer/{size}/164066_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-api-module-angle-setpoints-rapidly-flip-by-180-degrees/454007/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3306301,"name":"David B","username":"David_IsMe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/david_isme/{size}/196853_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T14:06:59.571Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI had a similar issue after setting up \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCTRE\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Cross The Road Electronics\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e swerve, turns out I didn’t know the difference in Clockwise and Counter clockwise.
